Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the significance of the musicians reciting God's names during the COVID-19 outbreak by stating that it is the first time in world history that musicians and singers from different religions have come together for this purpose.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to prove that the musicians reciting God's names in New Zealand is an effective method to face the COVID-19 outbreak.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that reciting God's names will have a positive impact on the COVID-19 outbreak without providing any scientific or factual basis for this assumption.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the video footage is from a concert held in Istanbul in 2011, not in New Zealand during the COVID-19 outbreak.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim presents an alternative explanation by suggesting that the musicians reciting God's names is a response to the COVID-19 outbreak, when in reality, it was a performance at a concert unrelated to the pandemic.
Understate: The claim understates the importance of providing accurate information during the COVID-19 outbreak by sharing misleading content and misrepresenting the origin and purpose of the video footage.
